That's great to hear that you're enjoying the process of learning your partner's language! Here are some suggestions for how you can practice speaking more fluently:

1. Practice with native speakers: Speak with native speakers of the language you're learning. You can engage with a language partner or hire a tutor to provide guidance.

2. Use language-based apps: Apps like Duolingo, Rosetta Stone, and Babbel can be helpful in learning a language. They also provide chances to practice speaking with real people and get feedback.

3. Listen and imitate: Practice listening to native speakers and imitate their pronunciation and cadence. Record yourself speaking so that you can identify areas that need improvement.

4. Read out Loud: Read texts or articles out loud, and then try to express it in the same language in your own words.

5. Attend language classes: Whether it's online or in-person, try attending a language class where you can converse with others and practice speaking in a structured environment.

Remember, consistent practice is key when it comes to improving fluency in a new language. Don't be afraid to make mistakes, and keep practicing with your partner and others who speak the language. You'll gain confidence and fluency over time!
